title: Mike Parker, R.I.P.
content:
We lost another type great: [http://cyrushighsmith.tumblr.com/post/77705701299/good-bye-mike-i-will-m...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414030250/http:/cyrushighsmith.tumblr.com/post/77705701299/good-bye-mike-i-will-miss-you "http://cyrushighsmith.tumblr.com/post/77705701299/good-bye-mike-i-will-miss-you")

[http://cyrushighsmith.tumblr.com/post/77708218644/i-met-mike-parker-in-t...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414030250/http:/cyrushighsmith.tumblr.com/post/77708218644/i-met-mike-parker-in-the-late-90s-soon-after-id "http://cyrushighsmith.tumblr.com/post/77708218644/i-met-mike-parker-in-the-late-90s-soon-after-id")

I only talked with Mike a few times, but his cheerful joi de vivre, decency, and lively mind shined out like a light house.
author: William Berkson

comments.content:
Wonderful and very candid interview with this great man here:  
 [http://vimeo.com/40960725](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414030250/http:/vimeo.com/40960725 "http://vimeo.com/40960725")

(Note the part where he talks about how development for new tech of a specific typeface was allocated to one of five firms. Made me wonder about monopolies and such.)
Awesome footage. Sad to see such a humble man go.

Not only humble, but immensely knowledgeable, and quite funny. RIP, Mike.

We are diminished.
